### Goal Description

<!---From Eva:
This goal measures the opportunity for fishers to supply seafood for themselves, families, and community.
--->

Artisanal fishing, often also called subsistance fishing, provides a critical source of food, nutrition, poverty alleviation and livelihood opportunities for many people around the world. In Hawai'i this is the opportunity for fishers to supply seafood for themselves, families, and community. This goal measure whether people who need to fish have the opportunity to do so. It is estimated based on need, access, and the condition of the resource based on fish biomass. A score of 100 means the region is meeting the needs of artisanal fishermen and communities.

### Model  

Status model for this goal is a function of need for artisanal fishing opportunities (the percent of households that fish), access to the resource (a funciton of shoreline access, steepness of the shoreline, and boat ramps), and the status of nearshore fishery resources.
